name: 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline
description: The 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline is a national network of local crisis centers that provides free and confidential emotional support to people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. The service is available to all Kentuckians and connects callers with trained crisis counselors who can provide immediate support, intervention, and referrals to local mental health resources.
source: Verified from official 988.ky.gov website and SAMHSA resources
hours_of_operation: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year
notes: Free, confidential crisis intervention and suicide prevention hotline. Available in English and Spanish. Can also text 988 or chat online at chat.988lifeline.org. Replaces the previous 1-800-273-8255 number. Kentucky has 14 regional community mental health centers that answer these calls.
